name: Alimara Barcelona Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When my SO and I saw the tempting offer of a one free night for this hotel, I automatically checked the reviews on TripAdvisor in order to make our minds up. And the majority of the positive reviews convinced us. We noticed thought that almost 3 years ago, there were some people not happy with their stay... So hear now what we have to say about our stay here.
reviews.title: You may encounter issues with this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, this so called 4 star hotel is badly located. It's in the north of the city, right to the circular highway surrounding the city. What does this means? Yes, it's quite noisy, so if you still want to go, be sure to ask for the room to be furthest possible from the highway (on the right side as you face the hotel). But don't bet your money that they will provide you with the room you asked for (we asked for a double room, got a twin one instead (it has happened, by the way, in all the hotels we had stayed before); however, the rest of the hotels gave us a double room when we had politely pointed out that this was our initial request; Alimara was the only hotel that refused that request, claiming that "no other double rooms were available).
reviews.title: Comfortable, out of center, yet accessable hotel

likes.liked: — It's price and room quality and size.
likes.disliked: — The proximity to a busy highway, hence noise in room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is true however that the hotel is quite close (less then 5 mins waling) from the Mundet subway station on the 3rd line) which allows you to get quickly downtown. I recommend using the subway: even if tempted to walk, you'll soon find out that your plan didn't indicate that in order to get to the city center you'll have to cross the hill where the Guell park is located, and the streets are quite steep.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great value!

likes.liked: — Price, size of room, closeness to metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting back to the hotel, the reception was quite glacial when I refused to provide them with the credit card details. They claimed that this way they were trying to insure we were going to pay the extras (like minibar and Pay TV). I insisted that we did not intend to consume anything from the minibar or to wath Pay per view. To this, they claimed that this was "the standard procedure across Spain" (fact denied by local Spanish relatives I asked). Finally, they gave up this request.
reviews.title: Roomy peaceful hotel near Metro station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I've already said, breakfast is not included, but I won't recommend to pay 11 € / person / breakfast. Instead, wake up at 9, go out from the hotel, go left, cross the street, then take the stairs down, go underneath the building and you're in a space with residences around. There underneath you'll see the entrance to a Consum supermarket, where you'll find what you'll need for quite a fine and cheap breakfast (and lunch and dinner, also).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Alimara was a perfect hotel. The room was nice and clean, and the staff always very polite and very helpfull ( restaurants ideas, transport).
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for Business and Leisure

likes.liked: — Clean hotel, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to the Alimara hotel for 5 nights and had a lovely clean, big room, not exactly 4 * standard maybe 3* is more accurate. The main problem we faced was the total lack of food places near the hotel. After a long hot flight and travelling we went on search for food, to find out there is only 1 restaurant, which looks more like a run down shack. And one tiny shop which closes at like 7, which we just managed to get to. The metro stop is a 3 min walk which is perfect and 12 mins into las ramblas. The metro is fab, and v cheap. Good hotel for price we paid, no pool which was kinda sad.
reviews.title: loved stay a bit out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As said elsewhere, the hotel is a bit out of the centre but easily accessible using the brilliant Metro.
reviews.title: On balance, good but not 4*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff do lighten up after a gag of two but initially seem a little surely. The hotel is owned by the University and attached to the school of turism running hotel managment / toursit degrees (tsk, don't they do real degrees in university anymore). I assume the staff are undergraduates getting experiernce.
reviews.title: Some of their front desk staff might ruin your holiday mood

reviews.text: Our grumbles: Breakfast was closed at 9.30 on the dot, in fact 9:29 and 37 seconds. Don't be late or go hungary and don't try to gain access after this time or you will be shot or worse as an example to other would be have-a-go hero guests. You can get breakfasst around the corner but the area is residential / stundent accomadation so no cosy cafe's. It was a little difficult getting a cab at peak times. mini-bar was not exactly overflowing with bottles. On arrival, midnight from Girona airport, we had to share a beer as there was only one in the fridge. No pool.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel a little far out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Likes: good size room, clean, felt safe and location near the metro station made it easy.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

likes.disliked: — A little far from the main sights, but easily accessible on the metro.

description: he Alimara Barcelona is a four stars hotel that merges perfectly modernity and experience to provide maximum comfort and a contemporary urban hotel style to our guest.Totally renovated at the end of 2010 offers 154 bedrooms all of them with outside views and fully equipped including 119 standard, 20 superiors and 15 junior suites/family rooms that can accommodate a family or a friendly group from 3 to 6 people, in a unique space but with two differentiated atmospheres.A very fine cuisine is served in any of their restaurants. La RONDA is the best place to begin your day with a delicious breakfast buffet. At the new SUMMUM Restaurant you can enjoy a Mediterranean flavoured menu, from Monday to Sunday, night and day. The SUMMUM Bar & Terrace is the perfect spot to have cocktails and bites.When finishing the day, the terrace of the garden and the fitness room become the best place to relax with environmental music.Our dedication and flexibility will suit your needs.For leisure and business, the Alimara Hotel is the best place to enjoy Barcelona.
